body.prompt: Respond to this question and explain your answer. Complete the sentence using one word: Roses are red, violets are

choices.text:
Blue.

My answer is "blue" because it is a traditional completion of the classic English poem:

Roses are red,
Violets are blue.
Sugar is sweet,
And so are you.

This rhyme scheme has been passed down for generations and is often used to express affection or friendship. Using the word "blue" is a common way to complete the poetic phrase, although other colors like purple or pink may also be used in variations of the poem.
